DOC.brief_summary: To evaluate clinical outcome AcrySof® ReSTOR® IOL Faculty Practice UTSW Medical Center Dallas
DOC.brief_title: Clinical Outcomes After AcrySof® ReStor IOL Surgery Faculty Practice UTSW Medical Center Dallas : A Retrospective Review
DOC.detailed_description: The AcrySof® ReSTOR® intraocular lens ( IOL ) late advance vision surgery . This IOL uniquely design improve vision throughout entire visual spectrum , close , far away everything in-between . Thus , give cataract patient best chance ever function free glass . The pre-operative post-operative data ReSTOR® IOL implant cataract surgery analyze determine whether desired outcome achieve , i.e . excellent vision correction . Variables study include patient age , gender , number ReSTOR® IOL implant , ocular comorbidities , preoperative postoperative correct uncorrected visual acuity , keratometry reading , corneal topography reading . A patient survey also send patient undergone surgery measure level satisfaction . Project Goals : The ultimate outcome project learn insight follow : 1 . Visual acuity without correction distance near 3-6 month 2 . Percent patient require keratorefractive surgery 3 . Ocular comorbidity subgroup analysis 4 . Monocular implantation subanalysis ( prior LASIK ) 5 . Comparison post-op spherical equivalent target refraction 6 . Posterior capsule opacity may treat laser procedure know YAG laser capsulotomy ? 7 . Subjective patient satisfaction 8 . Validated questionnaire assess visual function quality life
DOC.criteria: All patient race sex age 1890 year age undergone ReSTOR® IOL cataract surgery recruit retrospective project . Patients underwent conventional IOL cataract extraction surgery
